New Records: Jamie Leweling marked his Germany debut with a goal against the Netherlands.
Germany secured their place in the 2024/25 UEFA Nations League knockouts with victory over the Netherlands.
Julian Nagelsmann has now won 10 of 17 games as Germany head coach (D4, L3)
Key Match Events: Germany defeated the Netherlands 1-0 with Jamie Leweling's winning goal.
Debutant goalkeeper Oliver Baumann made key saves to preserve Germany's lead.
Stuttgart players featured in consecutive Germany games for the first time since 2009.
Pre-Game Insights: German football paid tribute to recently retired international quartet Manuel Neuer, Thomas Müller, Toni Kroos and İlkay Gündogan prior to kick-off.
Jamie Leweling marked his senior international debut with the winning goal as Germany secured their place in the 2024/25 UEFA Nations League knockouts.
Post-Match Reflections: Julian Nagelsmann praised his team’s resilience after coming back from 2-0 down in the match.
Germany had to withstand a wave of Netherlands pressure after the restart.
Germany had not won the Nations League before.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany have lifted four FIFA World Cups and three UEFA Euro titles, but the Nations League has so far eluded them.
Jamie Leweling, 23, scored twice across 17 appearances for Germany's U19s, 20s and 21s.
Three Stuttgart players featured in consecutive Germany games for the first time since 2009.
Others: Gnabry's 22 goals for Germany make him the highest-scoring current squad member. However, his last international goal came in March 2023.
